questions.question: What is the goal of the Best First Search algorithm?

answers.a: To find the longest path in a graph
answers.b: To find the path with the highest total weight in a graph
answers.c: To find the path with the lowest total weight in a graph
answers.d: To find the path that visits the most nodes in a graph

questions.question: What data structure is typically used to implement the frontier in Best First Search?
Which heuristic function can be used in Best First Search to ensure admissibility?

answers.a: The Euclidean distance between the current node and the goal node
answers.b: The number of nodes explored so far
answers.c: The sum of the weights of the edges in the path so far
answers.d: The maximum weight of the edges in the path so far

questions.question: What is the time complexity of Best First Search in the worst case?
What is a drawback of using Best First Search?

answers.a: It always finds the optimal solution
answers.b: It can get stuck in local minima
answers.c: It is not guaranteed to find a solution
answers.d: It requires a large amount of memory

questions.question: In Best First Search, how are nodes selected for expansion?

answers.a: Nodes are selected in a random order
answers.b: Nodes are selected based on their depth in the graph
answers.c: Nodes are selected based on a heuristic function
answers.d: Nodes are selected based on their parent nodes
